sen.j: 京都市立芸術大学（きょうとしりつげいじゅつだいがく、英称Kyoto City University of Arts）は、京都市西京区にある公立大学で、日本を代表する美術大学・音楽大学である。
sen.e: Kyoto City University of Arts is a public university which is located in Nishikyo-ku, Kyoto, and is one of the representative universities of arts and music in Japan.
Kyoto City University of Arts is a public university which is located in Nishikyo-ku, Kyoto, and is one of the premiere universities for arts and music in Japan.
Kyoto City University of Arts is a public university which is located in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto, and is one of the premiere universities for arts and music in Japan.

sen.j: 美術学部は、1880年に創設の京都府の画学校が起源。
sen.e: Faculty of Fine Arts originates from Kyoto-Fu Gagakko (Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting) which was founded in 1880.
Faculty of Fine Arts originates from Kyoto-Fu Gagakko (Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting) which was founded in 1880.
Faculty of Fine Arts originates from Kyoto-Fu Gagakko (Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting) which was founded in 1880.

sen.j: 6月に太政大臣三条実美公により「日本最初京都画学校」と命名された。
sen.e: In June, the school was named Nihon Saisho Kyoto Gagakko (Japan First Kyoto-style Art School)" by Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister), Duke Sanetomi SANJO. Opening ceremony of the school was held in the temporary school building at Jugosato Goten Palace in Kyoto Gyoen National Garden in July.
sen.cmt: 公→Duke (三条実美が公爵であったこと（出典：www.geocities.jp/nakanolib/rei/rm24-14.htm）から、次のHPを参照に「公→duke」と訳出： http://www.eudict.com/?lang=jpkeng&word=%E5%85%AC&go=Search） 1文４０文字以上のため、内容に区切りがあることから２文に分けました。
sen.e: In June, the school was named Nihon Saisho Kyoto Gagakko (Japan First Kyoto-style Art School)" by Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister), Duke Sanetomi SANJO. The opening ceremony for the school was held in the temporary school building at Jugosato Goten Palace in Kyoto Gyoen National Garden in July.
In June, the school was named Nihon Saisho Kyoto Gagakko" (Japan First Kyoto-style Art School) by Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister), Duke Sanetomi SANJO.
sen.cmt: "位置移動一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 7月に京都御苑内の旧准后里御殿仮校舎で開校式が行われた。
sen.e: The opening ceremony for the school was held in the temporary school building at Jugosato Goten Palace in Kyoto Gyoen National Garden in July.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 背景には、事実上の東京遷都によるパトロンの喪失・文明開化による伝統文化の冷遇などから、円山派・四条派といった京都画壇の諸派が危機に陥ったことにある。
sen.e: In the background, various Kyoto modern painters' schools including the Maruyamaha and Shijo schools were on the verge of a life-or-death crisis because they lost their patronage upon transfer of the capital to Tokyo in effect and because they were, as traditional culture, treated disfavorably due to civilization and enlightenment.

In the background, various Kyoto modern painters' schools including the Maruyamaha and Shijo schools were on the verge of collapse because they lost their patronage upon transfer of the capital to Tokyo, because they were, as traditional culture, treated disfavorably due to civilization and enlightenment.

In the background, various Kyoto modern painters' schools including the Maruyama and Shijo schools were on the verge of collapse because they lost their patronage upon transfer of the capital to Tokyo, because they were, as traditional culture, treated disfavorably due to civilization and enlightenment.

sen.j: 美術を立て直すために市民の間から美術家養成機関としての近代的な「学校」を作ろうという声が高まり、その熱意の結果創立されたものである。
sen.e: In order to get art activities back into shape, voices were raised among citizens to establish a modern "school" as a faculty for training artists, and as a result of their enthusiasm, the school was founded.

In order to get art activities back into shape, citizens voiced their desire to establish a modern "school" as a faculty for training artists, and the school was founded as a result of their enthusiasm.

In order to get art activities back into shape, citizens voiced their desire to establish a modern 'school' as a faculty for training artists, and the school was founded as a result of their enthusiasm.

sen.j: これには同じく文明開化で低迷していた京都の主力産業である伝統工芸の近代化を支援するため、密接な関係にある美術界を盛んにする目的もあった。
sen.e: Another purpose of this was to activate art circles that were closely related to the traditional arts and crafts, which were the main industries of Kyoto, in order to support modernization of the traditional arts and crafts.

Another purpose was to activate art circles that were closely related to traditional arts and crafts, which were the main industries of Kyoto, in order to support the modernization of traditional arts and crafts.

Another purpose was to activate art circles that were closely related to traditional arts and crafts, which were the main industries of Kyoto, in order to support the modernization of traditional arts and crafts.

sen.j: 画学校では修業年限3年間のうちに文人画や大和絵、狩野派など日本の美術の諸派を学ばせた。
sen.e: During the three-year term of training at Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting, various Japanese art schools including literati painting, Yamato-e painting (a traditional Japanese style painting of the late Heian and Kamakura periods dealing with Japanese themes), the Kano school were taught.

During the three-year term of training at Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting, various Japanese art schools including literati painting, Yamato-e painting (a traditional Japanese style painting of the late Heian and Kamakura periods dealing with Japanese themes), the Kano school were taught.

During the three-year term of training at Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting, various Japanese art schools including literati painting, Yamato-e painting (a traditional Japanese style painting of the late Heian and Kamakura periods dealing with Japanese themes), the Kano school were taught.

sen.j: また、殖産興業のために工芸品の意匠・デザインに関する教育をおこなうことも目的のひとつであり、その課程に西洋画を導入したことは当時としては画期的であった。
sen.e: Also, one of the other purposes was to provide education of design for crafts in view of encouraging new industry, and it was epoch-making for the school of that time to introduce Western Painting in the educational courses.
sen.cmt: 意匠・デザイン→design(マイページにて、意匠→designのため）
sen.e: Also, another purpose was to provide education in the design of crafts in order to encourage new industry, and it was history making for a school of that time to introduce Western Painting in educational courses.

Also, another purpose was to provide education in the design of crafts in order to encourage new industry, and it was history making for a school of that time to introduce Western Painting in educational courses.

sen.j: 西洋画は当初日本では、芸術文化の類というよりは建築などの図面を描く工業技術として、京都府画学校創立に先立つ1876年工部美術学校などで導入されていたからである。
sen.e: Western Painting was introduced in such an institute as Technology Art School in 1876 prior to the establishment of Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting and was studied as an industrial technology for drawing a construction plan rather than as art and culture, etc.

Western Painting was introduced as the Technology Art School in 1876 prior to the establishment of Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting and was studied as an industrial technology for drawing construction plans rather than as art and culture, etc.

Western Painting was introduced as the Technology Art School in 1876 prior to the establishment of Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting and was studied as an industrial technology for drawing construction plans rather than as art and culture, etc.

sen.j: 工部美術学校がアーネスト・フェノロサらによって西洋美術学習・研究の発展を妨害され、後発の東京美術学校もフェノロサや岡倉天心の意向によりながらく西洋画科が置かれなかったのとは対照的である。
sen.e: It was contrary to the facts that the progress in studies and researches for Western Painting were interrupted at Technology Art School by Ernest Fenollosa and that Department of Western Painting had not been established for a long time in Tokyo Fine Arts School, a school which was founded later, according to the intention of Fenollosa and Tenshin OKAKURA.

While the study and research towards Western Painting was interrupted at the Technology Art School by Ernest Fenollosa, in contrast, the Department of Western Painting had not been established for a long time in Tokyo Fine Arts School, a school which was founded later, based on the will of Fenollosa and Tenshin OKAKURA.

While the study and research towards Western Painting was interrupted at the Technology Art School by Ernest Fenollosa, in contrast, the Department of Western Painting had not been established for a long time in Tokyo Fine Arts School, a school which was founded later, based on the will of Fenollosa and Tenshin OKAKURA.

sen.j: 古くは京都画壇の中心地であったと言われ、また京都の陶磁器、漆工芸、染織などの地場産業に多くの人材を供給して活発化させた。
sen.e: Reportedly, it used to be a center for Kyoto modern painters in old days, and a large number of human resources were furnished to be located among industries such as ceramics, lacquer craftworks, and dyeing and weaving to activate the industries.
sen.cmt: マイページに記載の、染色→dying, 染色技術→dying technologiesは、dyeing …の誤植では？ 染織→dyeing and weaving (京都市立芸術大学HPより）
sen.e: Reportedly, it used to be a center for modern Kyoto painters in old days, and a large number of human resources were furnished to be located among industries such as ceramics, lacquer craftworks, and dyeing and weaving to invigorate industry.

Reportedly, it used to be a center for modern Kyoto painters in old days, and a large number of human resources were furnished to be located among industries such as ceramics, lacquer craftworks, and dyeing and weaving to invigorate industry.

sen.j: 明治以来多くの日本画家、洋画家、版画家、陶芸家、染織家、デザイナー、音楽家、現代美術作家を養成してきた。
sen.e: Since Meiji era, many Japanese painters, oil painters, printmakers, ceramic artists, dyeing and weaving professionals, designers, musicians, and modern art artists have been trained there.
sen.cmt: 現代美術作家→modern art artists (出典：英辞郎 on the web http://eow.alc.co.jp/%e7%be%8e%e8%a1%93%e4%bd%9c%e5%ae%b6/UTF-8/)
sen.e: Since Meiji era, many Japanese painters, oil painters, printmakers, ceramic artists, dyeing and weaving professionals, designers, musicians, and modern art artists have been trained here.
Since Meiji era, many Japanese painters, oil painters, printmakers, ceramic artists, dyeing and weaving professionals, designers, musicians, and modern art artists have been trained here.

sen.j: 過去京都市の財政難で国立大学へと移管する話もあった。
sen.e: In the past, Kyoto city experienced financial difficulties, and transition of the school to a national university was discussed; however, a large amount of donation was made for the school by those machi-shu (townspeople) and old families that have been in Kyoto from long time ago in order to rescue the school, which had been established as a product of strong compassion among the Kyoto citizens, from financial collapse. After integration with Kyoto-shiritsu Ongaku Tanki Daigaku (Kyoto City Junior College of Music), the school has still been a city university thus far.
sen.cmt: 40文字以上のセルのため２文に分けました。
sen.e: In the past, Kyoto city experienced financial difficulties, and the transition of the school to a national university was discussed; however, a large donation was made towards the school by machi-shu (townspeople) and old families with a long history in Kyoto in order to rescue the school. This was a result of the strong compassion felt by Kyoto citizens due to the financial collapse and after its integration with Kyoto-shiritsu Ongaku Tanki Daigaku (Kyoto City Junior College of Music), the school is still a city university thus far.
In the past, Kyoto city experienced financial difficulties, and the transition of the school to a national university was discussed
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: しかしながら、京都市民の熱望の賜物である学校の窮状を救おうと、古くからの町衆や旧家などから存続のための多数の寄付を受け、音楽短大と統合した今も市立大学であり続けている。
sen.e: However, a large donation was made towards the school by machi-shu (townspeople) and old families with a long history in Kyoto in order to rescue the school; this was a result of the strong compassion felt by Kyoto citizens due to the financial collapse and after its integration with Kyoto-shiritsu Ongaku Tanki Daigaku (Kyoto City Junior College of Music), the school is still a city university thus far.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処英文の読みやすさを重視し、原文とは語順を入れ替えて訳したため、原文を分割せず、二つの文をセミコロンで一文にしました。

tit.cmt: 出典：英辞郎 on the WEB (http://eow.alc.co.jp/%e5%ad%a6%e9%a2%a8/UTF-8/)

sen.j: - 京都府画学校として京都御所御苑内に開校。
sen.e: Kyoto-fu Gagakko (Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting) was founded within Kyoto Gyoen National Garden in Kyoto Imperial Garden.
Kyoto-fu Gagakko (Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting) was founded within Kyoto Gyoen National Garden in Kyoto Imperial Garden.
Kyoto-fu Gagakko (Kyoto Prefectural School of Painting) was founded within Kyoto Gyoen National Garden in Kyoto Imperial Garden.

sen.j: - 府から市に移管され、京都市画学校と改称、2年後の1891年に京都市美術学校に改称する。
sen.e: The management of the school was transferred from Kyoto Prefectural Government to Kyoto City, and the name of the school was changed to Kyoto-shi Bijyutsu Gakko (Kyoto Municipal School of Arts) two years later in 1891.
sen.cmt: 府から市に移管され→府（政府）から・・と訳出（from Kyoto Prefectural Government to Kyoto City): 京都市立芸術大学HPにて"The Universisty was established …by the Kyoto Prefectural Government …"を参照（http://w3.kcua.ac.jp/about/overvw.html）
sen.e: The management of the school was transferred from Kyoto Prefectural Government to Kyoto City, and the name of the school was changed to Kyoto-shi Bijyutsu Gakko (Kyoto Municipal School of Arts) two years later in 1891.

The management of the school was transferred from Kyoto Prefectural Government to Kyoto City, and the name of the school was changed to Kyoto-shi Bijutsu Gakko (Kyoto Municipal School of Arts) two years later in 1891.

sen.j: 工芸図案科が設置される。
sen.e: Craft and Design Course was established.
Craft and Design Course was established.
Craft and Design Course was established.

sen.j: 知恩院や京都御所御苑を点々とする
sen.e: The school facilities were moved to Chion-in Temple and then to various other places including Kyoto Imperial Palace.
The school facilities were moved to Chion-in Temple and then to various other places including Kyoto Imperial Palace.
The school facilities were moved to Chion-in Temple and then to various other places including Kyoto Imperial Palace.

sen.j: - 京都市立美術学校と改称、1909年に吉田に移転、1909年に系列校の京都市立絵画専門学校を設置（校長は兼任）
sen.e: The name of the school was changed to Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Gakko (Kyoto City School of Arts), the school was moved to Yoshida in 1909, and Kyoto-shiritsu Kaiga Senmon Gakko (Kyoto City Specialist School of Painting), an affiliate school in which president of Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Gakko also served as the president, was established.

The name of the school was changed to Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Gakko (Kyoto City School of Arts), the school was moved to Yoshida in 1909, and Kyoto-shiritsu Kaiga Senmon Gakko (Kyoto City Specialist School of Painting), an affiliate school in which president of Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Gakko also served as the president, was established.

The name of the school was changed to Kyoto-shiritsu Bijutsu Gakko (Kyoto City School of Arts), the school was moved to Yoshida in 1909, and Kyoto-shiritsu Kaiga Senmon Gakko (Kyoto City Specialist School of Painting), an affiliate school in which president of Kyoto-shiritsu Bijutsu Gakko also served as the president, was established.
The facilities of both schools were moved to Imakumano.
The facilities of both schools were moved to Imakumano.
The facilities of both schools were moved to Imakumano.

sen.j: - 京都市立絵画専門学校、京都市立美術専門学校と改称
sen.e: The name of Kyoto City Specialist School of Painting was changed to Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Senmon Gakko (Kyoto City Specialist School of Arts).
The name of Kyoto City Specialist School of Painting was changed to Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Senmon Gakko (Kyoto City Specialist School of Arts).
The name of Kyoto City Specialist School of Painting was changed to Kyoto-shiritsu Bijutsu Senmon Gakko (Kyoto City Specialist School of Arts).

sen.j: - 京都市立美術工芸学校、京都市立美術高等学校に。
sen.e: Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Kogei Gakko (Kyoto City Specialist School of Arts and Crafts) was reorganized to become Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Koto Gakko (Kyoto City Senior High School of Arts).
Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Kogei Gakko (Kyoto City Specialist School of Arts and Crafts) was reorganized to become Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Koto Gakko (Kyoto City Senior High School of Arts).

sen.j: 京都市立堀川高等学校に音楽課程設立
sen.e: Music Course was established in Kyoto Municipal Horikawa High School.
Music Course was established in Kyoto Municipal Horikawa High School.
Music Course was established in Kyoto Municipal Horikawa High School.

sen.j: - 京都市立美術高等学校、京都市立日吉ヶ丘高等学校ほかに継承（美術工芸科は1980年に独立し、京都市立銅駝美術工芸高等学校となる）
sen.e: The organization of Kyoto City Senior High School of Arts was succeeded by Kyoto Municipal Hiyoshigaoka High School and other schools (The Arts and Crafts Course in that senior high school was reorganized independently to become Kyoto City Dohda Senior High School of Arts in 1980.
sen.cmt: 美術工芸科→（京都市立美術高等学校の）美術工芸科→前述を受けて、The Arts and Crafts Course in that senior high school….と訳出
sen.e: The organization of Kyoto City Senior High School of Arts was succeeded by Kyoto Municipal Hiyoshigaoka High School and other schools (The Arts and Crafts Course in that senior high school was reorganized independently to become Kyoto City Dohda Senior High School of Arts in 1980.)

sen.j: - 京都市立美術専門学校、京都市立美術大学に。
sen.e: Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Senmon Gakko was reorganized to become Kyoto City University of Fine Arts.
Kyoto-shiritsu Bijyutsu Senmon Gakko was reorganized to become Kyoto City University of Fine Arts.

sen.j: 堀川高校音楽課程に専攻科設立
sen.e: The Special Study was established in the Music Course at Horikawa High School.
sen.cmt: 専攻科→Special Study （出典：英辞郎 on the web 例文”また、高校以上の学校の専攻科・別科・特殊年限のコースなどもあるが、一切省略した。 Though not mentioned in the foregoing, high schools and universities also offer various courses in special studies, special courses and limited term courses”（http://eow.alc.co.jp/%e5%b0%82%e6%94%bb%e7%a7%91/UTF-8/）
sen.e: The Special Study was established in the Music Course at Horikawa High School.
The Special Study was established in the Music Course at Horikawa High School.

sen.j: - 堀川高等学校音楽課程専攻科、京都市立音楽短期大学として独立。
sen.e: The Special Study in the Music Course at Horikawa High School was reorganized independently to become Kyoto City Junior College of Music.
The Special Study section under the Music Course at Horikawa High School was reorganized independently to become Kyoto City Junior College of Music.
The Special Study section under the Music Course at Horikawa High School was reorganized independently to become Kyoto City Junior College of Music.
Kyoto City Junior College of Music was moved to Shogoin in 1956.

sen.j: - 市立美術大学と市立音楽短期大学が統合し、京都市立芸術大学となる
sen.e: Kyoto City University of Fine Arts and Kyoto City Junior College of Music were integrated to become Kyoto City University of Arts.

sen.j: - 創立100周年を迎える、今熊野と聖護院から、郊外の新興住宅地に近い西京区大枝沓掛町に統合移転。
sen.e: The school marked 100th anniversary, and the school facilities in Imakumano and Shogoin were moved to Kutsukake-cho, Nishikyo-ku, the suburbs near a new residential area.
The school marked 100th anniversary, and the school facilities in Imakumano and Shogoin were moved to Kutsukake-cho, Nishikyo-ku, the suburbs near a new residential area.

sen.j: -創立120周年を迎える、大学院美術研究科博士（後期）課程設置、日本伝統音楽研究センター開設、
sen.e: The school marked 120th anniversary, the Doctor's Course (latter program) for Graduate School of Art was established, and Research Center for Japanese Traditional Music was launched.
